post.content:
세상은 예상한 대로 가는 것 같습니다. 내가 책에서 light framework (heavy framework such as EJB and Struts)라는 개념을 도입했는데, 이제 가볍고 생산성이 높은 프레임워크에 대한 수요가 생기는 듯하군요. 여기 웹사이트에서 누군가 보낸 글입니다.
Date: Mon, 12 Apr 2004 13:00:02 +0200 Reply-To: LE QUANG TU <vgbvn@numericable.fr> Sender: An interest list for Sun Java Center J2EE Pattern Catalog <J2EEPATTERNS-INTEREST@JAVA.SUN.COM> From: LE QUANG TU <vgbvn@NUMERICABLE.FR> Subject: Re: The best java/j2ee framework? Comments: To: Dao Xuan Nam <namdx@fujitsu.com.vn> Content-Type: multipart/related; type="multipart/alternative";
[multipart/alternative] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------Hi Nam,
I've found some j2ee frameworks that can support 3 tiers such as roja, realMethods, spring. What I'm looking for are something like reviews or suggestions of those. ----- Original Message ----- From: Dao Xuan Nam To: LE QUANG TU Sent: Monday, April 12, 2004 12:29 PM Subject: Re: The best java/j2ee framework?
Hi Tu,
In my understanding, you have no framework that can support you in 3 tier. But I think that you can intergrate some frameworks like Strut, Hibernate, ... for your problem.
In my company, I am responsible to design a framework for web-tier and another framework for Business Tier. Then, all web developers can use two frameworksl in developement. It saves much time.
Nam
